content: dive into the world of corner to corner crochet with my free easy crochet scarf pattern exclusively designed to envelop you in warmth and style worked seamlessly on the bias using the beloved c2c technique this pattern starts from a single corner effortlessly increasing until you achieve the desired width then maintaining for the perfect length before gracefully decreasing to form the final corner with no color changes required this pattern allows your chosen yarn to shine ideal for both beginners and seasoned crocheters this quick and mindless project is a must-have addition to your pattern collection discover the joy of creating timeless accessories with ease ❤ layout my patterns all share the same layout which is easy to read and easy to find important information you need such as materials needed sizing information gauge information and special stitches used as well as how to do them these stitches often come with an accompanying video for further clarification ❤ size you can make this one to your own size specifications my scarf was 6 5 wide x 62 long ❤ materials 5 weight yarn approx 400 yards - or any weight yarn you have in your stash with an appropriate sized hook 6mm hook stitch marker optional to denote which side you are reducing on scissors tapestry needle stitch markers optional to mark first or last stitch of the row
